name: Camera 101- Learn your Settings
description: Fun | Informative | Life Changing | Do you have a great camera but feel confused by settings? If so don’t worry, everyone starts in that place. Taking steps to educate yourself on your exposure triangle is the first step to your artistic freedom. It is important to know what settings to use at appropriate times. It essential to know why your settings matter, how they function alone and how they related to each other. [[tabs:start]] [[tab:heading:start]]About[[tab:heading:end]] [[tab:heading:start]]What's Covered[[tab:heading:end]] [[tab:heading:start]]Requirements for Class[[tab:heading:end]] [[tab:heading:start]]Scheduling [[tab:heading:end]] [[tab:heading:start]]Reviews[[tab:heading:end]] [[tab:content:start]] I love teaching this class and cannot wait to teach you!  Do you have a great camera but feel confused by settings? If so don’t worry, everyone starts in that place. Taking steps to educate yourself on your exposure triangle is the first step to your artist freedom. It is important to know what settings to use at appropriate times. It essential to know why your settings matter, how they function alone and how they related to each other. Online Classes are a perfect way to advance your photography career This class is not eligible for additional discounts. Regular price is $275, Private Class is on SALE now for $175- use code STUDENT50 for an EXTRA $50 OFF the sale price. Limited to 10 classes through September 30th. [[tab:content:end]] [[tab:content:start]] Class will Cover: Classes are 1.5-2 hours in length and you have time to take notes and to ask questions Class will focus on basic camera settings & shooting info. It is designed for users who want to better grasp their camera settings. Learn: ISO, Fstop, Shutter Triangle- this will be fully explained on a beginner level Grasp a deeper understanding of your camera and how it functions The importance of proper focus and how to get it White Balance Settings / Gray cards Learning to read your histogram & using it to get correct exposure Raw Verse Jpeg shooting Full Framed Verse Raw Metering for light, how to do it properly The importance of lens calibration & the effect an improper calibration will have on your images [[tab:content:end]] [[tab:content:start]] Requirements for classes: **Anyone can take our class. Our classes are PC & Mac compatible. Class covers all settings and is universal information so no matter what body you have this class information will help you advance your photography career. **There is no computer camera requirement aka icamera. Students can see my screen and we can hear other speak but we will not see each other. This means you can wear your pjs to class and no one is the wiser for it! **We require the following specs be met for classroom instruction. **You must have access to high-speed internet and be connected to the internet prior to your class start time **A mic & head phones or a head set is encourage for group conversation but is not required. I strongly recommend a computer headset. These can be purchase online or at local stores like Target or Amazon. They are roughly $10-12. **If purchasing a headset sure you purchase one with both a mic & earphone jack option and one that is computer compatible. ** Classes are non refundable unless the classes are canceled. [[tab:content:end]] [[tab:content:start]] All classes are coordinated around your schedule. I currently offer classes: Morning Mid-day Evening Simply check out then email me with your class purchase receipt and we will coordinate times together. All classes are scheduled based on EST. My contact email is photographersbling@me.com | if you have questions prior to booking I'd love to hear from you. [[tab:content:end]] [[tab:content:start]] Classes With me are fun and informative. We all start at the beginning and those who learn their settings go further in this industry than those who don’t. If your goal is to have a successful photography business classes are a necessity. “The most empowering thing you can do for yourself as a budding photographer is to learn your settings. Talent is important but knowing your settings, understanding your camera and being able to adjust those settings on fly will give you much more freedom as an artist. Remember the only stupid question is the unasked one. Get your camera smarts kicked into high gear and take the fear OUT of your shooting equation” Learning should be fun and with my classes it is! What students are saying My Camera 101 class with Nikki Bean tonight was A-MA-ZING!!! She did an awesome job of explaining so many different things about the camera and described each of them in detail to show how they all work together. Her repetition of important points really helped to reinforce what was important to remember. I could’ve listened to and talked with her for hours! I’m so excited to try out some of the things that I learned…I’ll let you (Nikki) know how it goes. Thanks again!!!” Susie Stefaniak Rondeau "I’m so glad that I decided to take this class tonight. Absolutely loved it— TONS of great information. I now have a much better understanding of all the different settings on my camera. I can’t wait to test out what I learned this weekend. Thank you Nikki Bean!"- Mariah Johnson [[tab:content:end]] [[tabs:end]]

This is a one / one phone chat session set up to allow you to ask advise & questions about getting your business legit and flourishing. [[tab:content:end]] [[tab:content:start]]

All Phone Mentoring sessions are based on your areas of interest

Classes Last 1.5-2 hours depending on your questions during class. Here are just some of the topics that past students have asked for help with: Setting up my business plan & marking. How do I set my prices? How can I improve my workflow? How can I increase business? What is LLC verse DBA ? What do I need for business insurance? How do I collect Sales tax? What do I need to start my business checking account? What equipment is needed to really get established ? What computer programs are recommended ? Should I work for free while portfolio building ? How do I stay busy and keep getting paid ? How do I know when my work is good enough to support me? Studio Lighting, what to use, when and how? (this is also available with screen images for visual explaining) Off camera flash – how to use it, when and why? Using a light meter or your cameras meter (also discussed in detail in my camera 101 course) [[tab:content:end]] [[tab:content:start]]

All classes are coordinated around your schedule.

I currently offer classes: Morning Mid-day Evening Simply check out then email me with your class purchase receipt and we will coordinate times together. All classes are scheduled based on EST. My contact email is photographersbling@me.com | if you have questions prior to booking I'd love to hear from you. [[tab:content:end]] [[tab:content:start]]

No questions are too basic

Your Class will be completely catered to your current abilities | After checkout you will receive a set of questions to fill out for class. Your entire class will based on YOUR questions. Nothing is off limits. [[tab:content:end]] [[tab:content:start]] Classes With me are fun and informative. We all start at the beginning and those who learn their settings go further in this industry than those who don’t. If your goal is to have a successful photography business classes are a necessity. “The most empowering thing you can do for yourself as a budding photographer is to learn your settings. Talent is important but knowing your settings, understanding your camera and being able to adjust those settings on fly will give you much more freedom as an artist. Remember the only stupid question is the unasked one. Get your camera smarts kicked into high gear and take the fear OUT of your shooting equation” Learning should be fun and with my classes it is! What students are saying My Camera 101 class with Nikki Bean tonight was A-MA-ZING!!! She did an awesome job of explaining so many different things about the camera and described each of them in detail to show how they all work together. Her repetition of important points really helped to reinforce what was important to remember. I could’ve listened to and talked with her for hours! I’m so excited to try out some of the things that I learned…I’ll let you (Nikki) know how it goes. Thanks again!!!” Susie Stefaniak Rondeau "I’m so glad that I decided to take this class tonight. Absolutely loved it— TONS of great information. I now have a much better understanding of all the different settings on my camera. I can’t wait to test out what I learned this weekend. Thank you Nikki Bean!"- Mariah Johnson [[tab:content:end]] [[tabs:end]]

name: Online Photoshop Training!
description: Fun | Informative | Life Changing [[tabs:start]] [[tab:heading:start]]About[[tab:heading:end]] [[tab:heading:start]]What's Covered[[tab:heading:end]] [[tab:heading:start]]Requirements for Class[[tab:heading:end]] [[tab:heading:start]]Scheduling [[tab:heading:end]] [[tab:heading:start]]Video Highlights[[tab:heading:end]] [[tab:content:start]] Learn to edit like a pro This Class is online and is a Pre-recorded class. A HUGE savings for anyone wanting to learn Photoshop who simply can't afford the $275 private live class rate. Today only just $15 bucks no coupon needed. Buy now watch later! Feeling a bit overwhelmed with what Photoshop has to offer? Want to edit like a pro but are feeling confused by layers, masks and basic tools? Editing is an extension of your artistic vision, the one you had on capture. Learning to edit as you 'see' the world will assist you in fulfilling your artist goals from each session. This is your final step in telling the story of your capture. Make it count in a positive way! Learning should be fun and with my classes it is! [[tab:content:end]] [[tabs:end]]
